Okay, well, I guess that works. Create a file `executor.js` in there. The idea is that we want to say `executor(commands).execute(directives)` where command is a list of the available commands for the system (with camel-case names, a description of the command, and example attributes/body for usiing the directve, as well as a function to actually execute the command) then return a function which looks at a list of directives (each of which has an `action`, `attributes`, and optional `body`) and executes the corresponding commands that it knows. Include a `validate` function on a per-command basis which takes `attributes` and the `body`; we want to allow multiple commands with the same name to handle variations in arguments.
